title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 August 2016 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has joined #xwiki  
02:39 <edvorg> has quit  
03:05 <jonesmeier> has quit  
03:16 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki

09:05 <Craeckie[m]> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <M-jsimard> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <M-yflory> has joined #xwiki

09:05 <M-vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <topical[m]> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <vmassol> good morning  
09:25 <vmassol> back from holidays!  
09:25 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <acotiuga> has quit  
10:48 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <vmassol> hmmm  
10:54 <vmassol> Enygma`: I think we may have made a mistake in the contributor id field  
10:55 <vmassol> I see we've been using the wiki page reference  
10:55 <vmassol> and sometimes just the vm name (such as "global.vm")  
10:56 <vmassol> I'm not sure anymore what I meant by this xproperty but now it seems using the extension id would be a better idea  
10:56 <vmassol> wdyt?  
10:57 <vmassol> and we have an autoredirect on exo to direct to the doc page when you have an extension id  
10:57 <vmassol> so it would be easy to link it too  
10:58 <vmassol> so I'm in favor of editing all UIX pages on xwiki.org and change the contributor id  
11:01 <Enygma`> vmassol: for vms it was nice to see exactly in which .vm file the uixp is defined, but I agree we should probably switch to extension IDs since it makes sense for the long run  
11:02 <Enygma`> in my case I was wondering what page to link there since there is no extension page for xwiki-platform-web, but then noticed that I can just put the vm file  
11:02 <vmassol> if we want detailed location of the uixp (vm name, java class name, etc) we could introduce another xproperty  
11:03 <Enygma`> yes, but in the end, I`m not sure it`s really that relevant  
11:04 <vmassol> trying to find the right syntax for exo  
11:04 <vmassol> http://extension.xwiki.org/?id=org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-search-solr-ui::: doesn't seem to work (for ex)  
11:04 <vmassol> ah wait  
11:04 <vmassol> missing an "s"  
11:05 <vmassol> works  
11:06 <Enygma`> why do we do that on xwiki.org for missing wikis? i.e. why not show the wiki does not exist, or at least redirect to the main wiki instead of forwarding to it?  
11:06 <Enygma`> been wondering about it for a while  
11:06 <vmassol> we have a "wiki does not exist" page?  
11:07 <Enygma`> it`s a vm  
11:07 <vmassol> we do go to the main wiki when a wiki is not found  
11:07 <vmassol> ah you mean forward vs redirect  
11:07 <Enygma`> ah, and a page too XWiki.WikiDoesNotExist  
11:08 <vmassol> I don't know. Is this a feature of xwiki or xwiki.org?  
11:08 <Enygma`> http://blabla.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Admin looks like it`s the admin user of the "blabla" wiki  
11:08 <Enygma`> but it`s not  
11:09 <vmassol> starting to modify all contirbutor ids  
11:10 <Enygma`> I`m not very sure what it is... it might be some apache configuration on xwiki.org, but the result is not natural to me  
11:10 <vmassol> for uixp  
11:10 <vmassol> yep I agree  
11:10 <vmassol> hmm  
11:11 <vmassol> the type of the xproperty is"page" so I'll need to change that to string  
11:11 <vmassol> changing it  
11:13 <vmassol> btw it's strange that we don't have a Page displayer that provides a link to the page  
11:13 <vmassol> (the LT doesn't display any linkà  
12:08 <vmassol> Pbas: myxwiki.org is back  
12:10 <vmassol> 870 failures for http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/ :(  
12:11 <vmassol> lots of "WARNING: Unescaped ' character"  
13:42 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <Joerg> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <Joerg> is now known as <Guest47634>  
14:21 <Guest47634> Hello, i search for the server requiments for xwiki and cant find them. could someone help me out?  
14:29 <vmassol> Guest47634: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HHardwareandSoftwarerequirements  
14:30 <Guest47634> thanks, vmassol , but i miss the prozessor sepcs  
14:31 <vmassol> indeed we're missing that, not sure what to put since it depends on what you'll do with yuor wiki  
14:32 <vmassol> I don't have much experience myself  
14:32 <vmassol> I'll ask around  
14:32 <Guest47634> its for 200-250 registrated users.. thank you  
14:33 <vmassol> yep I saw your requests to XWiki SAS ;)  
14:33 <vmassol> the number of users is not a parameter for this though  
14:33 <vmassol> TPS would be a better parameter  
14:34 <vmassol> but it depends a lot on memory too  
14:34 <vmassol> and about what you'll use xwiki for  
14:34 <vmassol> hard to recommend anything  
14:34 <vmassol> I know xwiki installs with several 100K of users that require very little cpu  
14:35 <vmassol> and I knoow installs with 5 users that require huge cpu ;)  
14:35 <vmassol> (because that wiki doesn't a lot of processing)  
14:37 <Guest47634> its primariy for an lexicon used, but we dont have a one server... so they send me on the quest to find out what we need  
14:38 <Guest47634> troubeling i´m a preacher not an it sepcialist...  
14:38 <vmassol> :)  
14:39 <vmassol> you need it installed on premises? Otherwise you could use xwiki cloud, see http://www.xwiki.com/en/products/try-xwiki-cloud  
14:42 <Guest47634> i would prefare the cloud. but the budget i get is not so big... so the hosting is the cheaper solution  
14:46 <vmassol> cloud is hosting  
14:46 <vmassol> you mean self hosting?  
14:48 <vmassol> I see on http://www.xwiki.com/en/products/pricing that the price is 200 euros/month and that includes backup/support/etc. anyway your choice! :)  
15:06 <msmeria> has quit  
15:21 <vmassol> M-cjd: you htere?  
15:22 <vmassol> (wanted to know if you were aware of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13474 )
